title: Packaging CDK
text: CDK2.0 release 25MB. try reduce size built version CDK libs removes several sub-libraries. can now use target/cdk-2.0.jar inclusion rcdklibs
code: git clone https://github.com/cdk/cdk.git  cd cdk/bundle  #checkout the tag of the released version git checkout -b rcdk2 cdk2-2.0  vi pox.xml  # remove the entries for: # builder3d # builder3d-tools # cdk-pdb # cdk-pdbcml  mvn package

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Guha R (2024). rcdklibs: CDK Libraries Packaged R. R package version 2.9, https://cdk-r.github.io/rcdklibs/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rcdklibs: The CDK Libraries Packaged for R},   author = {Rajarshi Guha},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2.9},   url = {https://cdk-r.github.io/rcdklibs/}, }

what: The CDK Libraries Packaged for R
title: The CDK Libraries Packaged for R
text: goal rcdklibs provide CDK jarfiles thereby facilitate chemoinformatic analysis within R ecosystem. primary consumer rcdklibs rcdk package CDK’s functionality can accessed standard rJava API. libs provided release correspond 2.9 Release
code: # Example library(rcdklibs)  # atm_container class atm_container <- J("org/openscience/cdk/AtomContainer")  # instance of class ac1 <- new(atm_container)  # call method (reflective). slow but easy to program/use. ac1$atoms()  # call method example (static). Cumbersome to program but needed for Java speed. .jcall(atom, "Ljavax/vecmath/Point3d;", "getPoint3d")
